program_name: Revolving Funds for Financing Water and Wastewater Projects (Revolving Fund Program)
program_description: This program helps qualified nonprofits create revolving loan funds that can provide financing to extend and improve water and waste disposal systems in rural areas.
applicant_eligibility_nonprofits_legal_a: Legal authority to operate a revolving loan fund
applicant_eligibility_nonprofits_capacit: Financial, technical, and managerial capacity to comply with relevant state and federal laws and regulations
how_to_get_started_contact: Contact a USDA Rural Development program specialist in the state or territory in which the proposed revolving loan fund will be available.
how_to_get_started_assistance: Our program specialists will help you start the application process.
grant_funds_purpose: These grants are used to create a revolving loan fund to help eligible water or wastewater systems serving rural areas, and which are owned and operated by:
revolving_loan_fund_recipients_must_1: Be unable to get commercial credit for the proposed project
revolving_loan_fund_recipients_must_2: Have - or secure - legal authority to own and operate the system, and to get a revolving loan
revolving_loan_funds_use_1: Pre-development costs of water and wastewater projects
revolving_loan_funds_use_2: Small capital improvement projects that are not part of regular operations and maintenance
revolving_loan_fund_terms_interest_rate_: The interest rate is determined by the nonprofit that manages the revolving loan fund, and must be approved by USDA's Rural Utilities Service
eligible_area_description: Rural areas and towns with populations of 10,000 or fewer.
questions_answer_source_1: Staff in your local Rural Development office
governing_program_regulation_1_name: Code of Federal Regulation 7 CFR Part 1783
governing_program_regulation_2_name: Section 306 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act
why_usda_rural_development_does_this_pur: This program helps small communities extend and improve water and waste facilities for households and businesses in eligible rural areas.
why_usda_rural_development_does_this_ben: Good practices can save tax dollars, improve the natural environment, and encourage rural manufacturers and other businesses to locate or expand operations.
note_consult_official_instructions: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_usda_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
